title: Ronaldo, Messi on Ballon list
text:
Ronaldo, Messi on Ballon list Source: Agencies | October 21, 2015, Wednesday | Print Edition 
CRISTIANO Ronaldo and Lionel Messi again head the list of candidates for the player of the year award, which they have combined to win for the past seven years. 
All 23 players named on the Ballon D’Or Award shortlist yesterday play for European clubs, though eight are from South America and one, Ivory Coast midfielder Yaya Toure, is African. No Asian player or club featured in the nominations compiled by FIFA and France Football magazine. English and Italian players also failed to make the list. 
Messi was joined by Brazilian Neymar and Luis Suarez of Uruguay giving Barcelona its complete forward line on the list. Barcelona, which won La Liga, the Champions League and domestic cup last year, has the most players on the shortlist with Spanish midfielder Andres Iniesta, Argentine defender Javier Mascherano and Croatian Ivan Rakitic joining its front three on the list. 
Real Madrid has five players with Karim Benzema of France, Wales’ Gareth Bale, Colombian James Rodriguez and German Toni Kroos also named alongside Portugal’s Ronaldo. 
German champion Bayern Munich also has five representatives with Robert Lewandowski, Thomas Mueller, Arjen Robben, Arturo Vidal and goalkeeper Manuel Neuer. 
Apart from Vidal, Copa America champion Chile also has Alexis Sanchez nominated, plus coach Jorge Sampaoli on the 10-man list of nominees for coach of the year. 
The winners will be announced on January 11 at a ceremony in Zurich. The list of Ballon d’Or nominees will be shortened to the final three contenders on November 30 with Messi and Ronaldo almost certain to make the cut. 
Despite neither winning a major national team title, Messi and Ronaldo have shared the Ballon d’Or since 2008. Messi has won four awards and Ronaldo three, including in 2013 and 2014. 
Sampaoli is competing with nine coaches of European clubs, including Luis Enrique of Barcelona and Jose Mourinho of English champion Chelsea. 
Voting is by national team coaches and captains, plus a selected journalist, from each of FIFA’s 209 member federations. Polling closes on November 20.
